intro: Pimpinella siifolia var. macrodonta, commonly known as the large-fruited cowparsley, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with finely divided, fern-like leaves and small white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are distinctive, featuring large, ridged mericarps that aid in wind dispersal. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
